fullProgramDescription: The Interdisciplinary Studies major is designed for students who wish to pursue an individually tailored course of study that doesn't fit within a single department or existing major. Students, in consultation with faculty advisors, design a coherent program that integrates multiple disciplines. The major requires a minimum of 12 upper division courses, including a senior colloquium and a minimum of 3 courses in each of 2 or 3 focus areas.
shortProgramDescription: The Interdisciplinary Studies B.A. allows students to create a customized major by combining courses from multiple departments, tailored to their individual interests and academic goals.
classHighlights: Students take a minimum of 12 upper division courses, which must include a senior colloquium.
The major requires at least 3 courses in each of 2 or 3 focus areas, allowing students to explore multiple disciplines.
Courses are chosen in consultation with faculty advisors to create a coherent program.
The major is designed to be highly flexible, accommodating a wide range of academic interests and career goals.
learningOutcomes: Design a coherent, interdisciplinary course of study that integrates multiple disciplines.
Demonstrate a broad understanding of the chosen fields of study.
Apply critical thinking, research, and analytical skills across disciplines.
Communicate effectively about complex, interdisciplinary topics.

similarPrograms.title: Interdisciplinary Studies in Arts and Culture

additionalInformation: Students must find a faculty sponsor and submit a proposal for their major course of study. The major is designed to be flexible and accommodate a wide range of academic interests.
